title: phoenix chief says police response to incident with 4-year-old is 'unacceptable'

annotations.text: "I, like many others, am sick over what I have seen in the video"

title: get these trending washington restaurants on your radar today

annotations.text: Washington's buzziest local spots
annotations.openFeedback: Uses hype language like "buzziest" to amplify interest beyond neutral description.

annotations.text: which spots are riding a trend, right now
annotations.openFeedback: Dramatizes popularity with metaphorical phrasing to make venues seem especially in-demand.

annotations.text: this Italian spot, which offers pizza, salads and more, is trending
annotations.openFeedback: Labeling the restaurant as "trending" heightens its appeal beyond simple reporting of review data.

annotations.text: saw a substantial 116.7% increase
annotations.openFeedback: Qualifies the numerical increase as "substantial," adding evaluative emphasis to the statistic.

annotations.text: Whether or not you've been hearing buzz about Dupont Circle's Astoria DC , the cocktail bar and Szechuan spot is a hot topic
annotations.openFeedback: Phrases like "hearing buzz" and "hot topic" amplify perceived popularity and excitement.

annotations.text: bagged a staggering 141.7% increase in new reviews
annotations.openFeedback: Words like "bagged" and "staggering" dramatize the numerical increase.

annotations.text: There's more that's trending on Washington's cocktail bar scene
annotations.openFeedback: Describes the broader scene as "trending," heightening a sense of widespread excitement.

annotations.text: Columbia Heights' Rooster & Owl is also making waves
annotations.openFeedback: Idiom "making waves" suggests outsized impact and excitement beyond neutral description.

annotations.text: There's more than one hot spot trending in Washington's New American category
annotations.openFeedback: Terms like "hot spot" and "trending" are promotional and heighten perceived desirability.

annotations.text: Over the past month, it's maintained a solid 4.5-star rating among Yelpers
annotations.openFeedback: Calling the rating "solid" adds a positive evaluative spin to the metric.

annotations.text: Capitol Hill's CIRCA at Navy Yard is the city's buzziest traditional American spot by the numbers
annotations.openFeedback: Labeling it "the city's buzziest" amplifies its status and appeal.

annotations.text: popular Busboys and Poets - Brookland is currently on the upswing
annotations.openFeedback: Words like "popular" and "on the upswing" promote a positive, rising image.

annotations.text: Review counts increased by more than 400% on a month-to-month basis
annotations.openFeedback: Highlighting a 400% increase without broader context can magnify perceived momentum.

title: south african woman reunited with son six years after he disappeared and was tracked down 1,000 miles away

annotations.text: The pictures and footage only scratch the surface of the tale
annotations.openFeedback: Suggests the story is far more dramatic than shown, heightening emotional impact.

annotations.text: was distraught when her son, who is mentally challenged, disappeared
annotations.openFeedback: Emotionally descriptive but not targeting a group or pushing a broader agenda.

annotations.text: My heart is going out for her. We should help this woman
annotations.openFeedback: Expresses compassion without demonizing others or oversimplifying causes.

annotations.text: I saw the desperation on her, and her poor circumstances.
annotations.openFeedback: Descriptive of an individual’s hardship, not used to attack or blame a group.

annotations.text: In 90% of missing persons cases, it doesn't end well. It gets to us
annotations.openFeedback: Somber statistic and emotional reaction, but not framed as blame or propaganda.

annotations.text: took vacation time, and used the policeman's private car for the two-day journey
annotations.openFeedback: Commendatory detail about individual effort, not manipulative or polarizing.

annotations.text: People are very negative about the police, but there are good police officers who go out of their way to help the community
annotations.openFeedback: Contrasts common negativity with a positive image of police, encouraging a more favorable general view without evidence beyond this anecdote.

title: Protest in Madrid as conservatives suspend ban on most polluting cars

annotations.text: raising fears that environmental rollbacks seen in the United States may be spreading to Europe
annotations.openFeedback: Frames the policy change as part of a broader, spreading rollback, potentially overstating its wider implications.

annotations.text: Yes we can, I do want Madrid central
annotations.openFeedback: The article quotes a chant used by protesters ('Yes we can'), which is a recognizable political slogan used to simplify the cause and rally emotional support.

annotations.text: We have to save (the planet) starting at the local and small level
annotations.openFeedback: Portrays local traffic policy as part of literally saving the planet, amplifying its global impact.

annotations.text: because the heat worsens pollution
annotations.openFeedback: Provides a factual causal link without oversimplifying broader policy debates.

annotations.text: as they seek to phase out all fossil fuel cars in the coming decade
annotations.openFeedback: States policy goals without emotional or polarizing framing.

annotations.text: slashed air pollution levels from car emissions in the center to record lows
annotations.openFeedback: Uses strong language (“slashed”, “record lows”) that emphasizes dramatic impact and may overstate certainty.

annotations.text: to make it "compatible with citizens' mobility needs"
annotations.openFeedback: Presents the stated rationale of officials without emotional or polarizing wording.

annotations.text: there's no precedent in ending a car traffic restriction
annotations.openFeedback: Portrays the move as unprecedented at the European level, potentially overstating its uniqueness.

annotations.text: would face sanctions and a possible lawsuit if it fails to meet air quality standards
annotations.openFeedback: Describes potential legal consequences in neutral, institutional terms without emotional loading.

title: Missouri's only abortion clinic to remain open after judge's injunction holds

annotations.text: dealt it a blow, declining to renew its license. But State Circuit Court Judge Michael Stelzer ruled in favor of the embattled health center
annotations.openFeedback: "dealt it a blow" and "embattled" dramatize the conflict and hardship.

annotations.text: Today is a victory for women to be able to access the kind of medical care that they and their health professionals need and deserve
annotations.openFeedback: Frames the ruling as a sweeping "victory for women," amplifying its significance.

annotations.text: It is still very, very difficult to access abortion in Missouri because of medically unnecessary hoops and regulations
annotations.openFeedback: Phrases like "very, very difficult" and "medically unnecessary hoops" heighten the sense of burden.

annotations.text: And that is a good day for women
annotations.openFeedback: Generalizes the outcome as broadly positive for all women, simplifying a complex issue.

annotations.text: patient safety was gravely compromised, failed surgical abortions in which women remained pregnant
annotations.openFeedback: The phrase "gravely compromised" is highly charged and intensifies the seriousness of the incident.

annotations.text: greater anti-abortion effort by the state's administration
annotations.openFeedback: Frames the licensing dispute as simply part of a larger anti-abortion effort, downplaying other possible regulatory motives.

annotations.text: another medically unnecessary requirement that the state was putting on it to whittle down Missouri residents' access to abortion
annotations.openFeedback: Portrays the requirement as solely aimed at reducing access, simplifying regulatory motives.

annotations.text: stringent and perpetually evolving requirements, with some closing and then reopening again and then shuttering for good
annotations.openFeedback: "Stringent and perpetually evolving" and "shuttering for good" dramatize the regulatory burden and outcomes.

annotations.text: a slew of recent anti-abortion legislation across the country
annotations.openFeedback: "A slew" suggests an overwhelming volume of legislation, heightening perceived scale.
